event.title: was founded by German settlers in 1885

data.event: The community, initially named Wawaka, was founded by German settlers in 1885, and its post office was opened in 1901.
The community, initially named Wawaka, was founded by German settlers in 1885, and its post office was opened in 1901.

When another community, Burnside, was platted along the Panhandle and Santa Fe Railway 3 miles (5 km) away, Wawaka's residents and its postmaster moved to Burnside; the community was renamed Waka in 1921, two years after the Wawaka residents moved, but the post office remained "Wawaka" for six years.

event.title: two years after the Wawaka residents moved

data.event: When another community, Burnside, was platted along the Panhandle and Santa Fe Railway 3 miles (5 km) away, Wawaka's residents and its postmaster moved to Burnside; the community was renamed Waka in 1921, two years after the Wawaka residents moved, but the post office remained "Wawaka" for six years.

When another community, Burnside, was platted along the Panhandle and Santa Fe Railway 3 miles (5 km) away, Wawaka's residents and its postmaster moved to Burnside; the community was renamed Waka in 1921, two years after the Wawaka residents moved, but the post office remained "Wawaka" for six years.
In 2014, it was announced that, by March 29, the Post Office in Waka would close.
